articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: All members of the European Union must boost their defence spending to fill gaps in the bloc's capabilities and secure continued support for Ukraine, Germany's new Chancellor Friedrich Merz said in Paris on Wednesday.
articles.title: Germany's Merz calls on EU allies to boost defence spending on first foreign visit

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Multiple loud explosions were heard in several places in Pakistan and Pakistani Kashmir on Wednesday as India said it had attacked "terrorist infrastructure" in nine sites and Pakistan vowed to respond to the attacks.
articles.title: India says it attacked nine sites in Pakistan, Pakistani Kashmir

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli strikes on a school housing displaced families in northern Gaza killed 13 Palestinians, local health authorities said, as Israeli forces continued to demolish homes and buildings in Rafah in the south of the enclave.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill 13 in Gaza school housing displaced families, medics say

articles.author: Crispian Balmer, Joshua McElwee, Philip Pullella
articles.description: Roman Catholic cardinals will begin the task of electing a new pope, locking themselves away from the world until they choose the man they hope can unite a diverse but divided global Church.
articles.title: Cardinals set to enter conclave to decide who follows Pope Francis

articles.author: Andrea Shalal, David Lawder, Steve Holland
articles.description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and chief trade negotiator Jamieson Greer will meet China's top economic official He Lifeng in Switzerland this weekend for talks, U.S. and Chinese officials said, in what could be a first step toward resolving a trade war disrupting the global economy.
articles.title: US, Chinese officials to hold ice-breaker meeting in Geneva on Saturday

articles.author: Mohammed Ghobari
articles.description: The Israeli military carried out an airstrike on Yemen's main airport in Sanaa on Tuesday, its second attack in two days on Iran-aligned Houthi rebels, after the group launched a missile attack near Israel's Ben Gurion Airport.
articles.title: Israel hits Yemen's main airport in airstrike against Houthis

articles.author: Andrew Osborn, Laurie Chen
articles.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping is due to start a four-day visit to Russia on Wednesday, giving President Vladimir Putin an important diplomatic boost at a time when the Russian leader is keen to show his country is not isolated on the world stage.
articles.title: China's Xi set to begin Russia visit in symbolic show of support for Putin against West

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Explosions were heard in the Sudanese city of Port Sudan early on Wednesday, a Reuters witness reported, adding that the Sudanese army launched anti-aircraft missiles.
articles.title: Explosions heard in Port Sudan, army launched anti-aircraft missiles, Reuters witness says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: India launched strikes on Pakistan and Pakistani Kashmir on Wednesday, an assault Pakistan has called a "blatant act of war" as tensions escalate between the arch rivals after a deadly attack on tourists in Indian Kashmir.
articles.title: What happened in India's attack on Pakistan over Kashmir tourists killings?

articles.author: Hatem Khaled, Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Olivia Le Poidevin
articles.description: Palestinian baby Jenan Alskafi died in Gaza on Saturday after malnutrition and digestive problems, which her doctor said could not be treated because of a total Israeli blockade that aid agencies believe is undermining the entire population's health.
articles.title: Gaza hunger crisis ripples across health sector as Israeli blockade endures
